article: For many, just taking part in a single marathon is the achievement of a lifetime. But for Julie Weiss, it has [KS5UKS5U]become a _ routine. She has run 52marathons---once a week---for the past year in memory of her dad who passed away just 35 days after he was _ with pancreatic cancer . When Julie Weiss lost her father in 2010, she was _ to find the research for pancreatic cancer is so short of fund. " It made me feel _ ." she said, "I knew I had to do something." So this marathon queen, _ she calls herself, did what she did best; she went running. Having completed 25 marathons during the _ two years, Julie now vowed to run 52 marathons in 52 weeks in _ of her father. After asking people to _ money for each marathon, she set up a website, marathon goddess, com, to collect money for the Pancreatic Cancer Action Network(PANCAN), a nonprofit organization. Julie began her incredible _ with a marathon is Rome and then entered a race every _ in some city across North America. _ leaving work at 5p.m.on Friday she would be ready to begin the next race, before she _ home to California on Sunday. Julie finished her 1,362.4-mile journey in March 2013, _ more than $ 200,000 in the process for PANCAN. While running, she stuck to a strict training schedule. "My body's getting used to this. I'm changing my diet, becoming more healthy and learning to run more _ ." she said. When her muscles began to _ , she kept her _ in mind.
